title: Can an average student crack the IIT with one year of preparation? - Quora

response.answer_text: I think if you have the potential and well determined then YES you can. When I was in class 12 I wrote my first attempt of jee but didn't got a very good rank(somewhere around 10k in jee advanced and 12-13k in jee mains). So I was getting a decent nit but yet I was not very much satisfied with that as was not getting a good iit. So I decided to repeat and again the “Race of IIT began “. I studied very hard and then jan attempt came . I got 99.5 percentile in jan attempt and nothing great happened in sept attempt and 99.5 was considered as the best of two with a crl-6222. Fine,so now onwards I was focusing on jee advanced more then BitSat. But during that I did never aim for a particular rank this time because during my first attempt I developed a self pressure by thinking of some particular rank.Finally I wrote my jee adv paper. I did not attempt a large number of questions(something like 33–35 ques in each paper) but I was confident that these will be correct. And finally I got 202 Marks and AIR-1289 in jee advanced.Also my bitsat score was 342. So I think it is possible to get into iit in a year.

It depends on the school district. School districts in India have curriculum that varies a lot. Having said that, an average student will have a hard time cracking IIT JEE exam within one year of preparation. I am a product of New Delhi Public school and I made it without any preparation in 1965. I was in the top 5% of student body and at that time, Delhi science curriculum focussed on engineering and medicine. Since then, the competition for IIT has increased and the public school education has taken a nose dive.

This question is made for me. I did not study a bit for jee in my 11 and 12. I had planned to take a year drop and ace a good jee rank. I knew it was hard but doable. So I did it. I took a year drop, joined a coaching institute, did my best, put my heart and soul in it for a year and here I am today with a 1116 rank in advanced (obc) and 6426 (gen). I have got iit Kanpur mechanical in first round of counselling and hoping for upgradation in the next rounds to come. I even got a 518(gen) rank in wbjee this time. So you see it is possible.

Yes of course. Sincere preparation of one year results in a better rank. But the only prerequisite is your attitude of rectification. The faster you rectify your mistakes the easier will be your preparation.

Yes they could if they have a back up with reservation!! (Not to wound any of my friends, but just the harsh reality). Even then the probability is lower than others, as today's world is preparing for IIT from the age of 14.
